page.title: 16Cupar's Rural Environment
page.content: {Landscape}to the North and East of Cupar is attractive undulating countryside,169m. at its highest point. It is prime quality{farming {land with}dispersed settlements_ farms, cottages, large houses such as Kinloss & Dalgairn Houses, & the hamlet of Foodie Ash (population of 30_40) in the far north of the block. Woodland is mainly deciduous & mostly made up of shelter belts & hedgerow trees. There is a network of farm tracks & B roads which converge on Cupar. The area is{drained}by the River Eden flowing from west to east through Cupar.{Hawklaw Radio Station {is}situated on a hill in the centre of the block overlooking Cupar.
